cosmology.name: The Great Wheel
cosmology.description: The default D&D cosmology includes more than two dozen planes. The most common understanding visualizes them as concentric wheels, with the material realms at the center. The Inner Planes form a wheel around the Material Plane, enveloped in the Ethereal Plane. The Outer Planes form another wheel around that one, arranged according to alignment, with the Outlands linking them all.

alternateConfigurations.name: World Tree
alternateConfigurations.description: Planes situated among the roots and branches of a great cosmic tree (literally or figuratively)

alternateConfigurations.name: Astral-Elemental Split
alternateConfigurations.description: Material realms suspended between two other realities: the astral realms (the Astral Plane and the Outer Planes) above and the elemental realms (the Inner Planes) below

alternateConfigurations.name: Simplified Cosmology
alternateConfigurations.description: A cosmology with fewer planes: a Material Plane; the Transitive Planes; a single undifferentiated Elemental Plane; an Overheaven where good deities and Celestials dwell; and an Underworld where evil deities and Fiends reside

alternateConfigurations.name: Orbital Model
alternateConfigurations.description: Planes arranged in a complex system of orbits, with planes exerting greater influence on the Material Plane the closer they draw to it

planeCategories.name: Material Realms
planeCategories.description: Most D&D worlds are located on the Material Plane, which has two planar echoes: the Feywild and the Shadowfell.

planeCategories.name: Transitive Planes
planeCategories.description: The Ethereal Plane and the Astral Plane are boundless realms that provide passage between other planes of existence.

planeCategories.name: Inner Planes
planeCategories.description: The four Elemental Planes (Air, Earth, Fire, and Water), plus the Para-elemental Planes between them, are the Inner Planes.

planeCategories.name: Outer Planes
planeCategories.description: Seventeen Outer Planes correspond to the nine alignments and shades of philosophical difference between them.

planeCategories.name: Positive and Negative Planes
planeCategories.description: These two planes enfold the rest of the cosmology, providing the raw forces of life and death that underlie all existence in the multiverse.

planes.name: Shadowfell
planes.philosophicalEssence: A gloomy dimension of death, gloom, and dread. The Shadowfell overlaps the Material Plane, with landmarks that appear similar but distorted and sinister.
planes.emotionalInfluence: A melancholic atmosphere pervades the Shadowfell, and extended forays to this plane can afflict characters with despair.

physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: The sky is a black vault with neither sun nor stars.

temperature.description: Generally gloomy and cold, with no natural light sources in the sky.

physicalProperties.weatherPatterns: Perpetual gloom with no natural sunlight or starlight.

timeFlow.description: Time flows normally on the Shadowfell.

hazards.name: Shadowfell Despair
hazards.description: A melancholic atmosphere pervades the Shadowfell. When deemed appropriate, usually not more than once per day, a character not from the Shadowfell must make a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the character is affected by despair, with effects determined by rolling on the Shadowfell Despair table.

savingThrowToTraverse.triggerDescription: When the DM deems it appropriate, usually not more than once per day.

onFailure.description: The character is affected by despair. Roll 1d6 on the Shadowfell Despair table to determine the effect. A new despair effect replaces any existing one.
onFailure.duration: Until removed by a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw after finishing a Long Rest, or by a Calm Emotions spell or magic that removes curses.

onSuccess.description: The character resists the melancholic pull of the Shadowfell and is unaffected.

recoveryMethods: DC 15 Wisdom saving throw after a Long Rest

entries.durationDescription: Until removed. The character has Disadvantage on Death Saving Throws and Initiative rolls.
Until removed. The character has Disadvantage on all saving throws.
Until removed. The character has Disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws that use Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma.

hazards.name: The Mists of the Domains of Dread
hazards.description: Mists surround each of the Domains of Dread, making it difficult to leave one domain and even harder to find a path to another. The Mists rise and fall at the whim of the Dark Powers, and they can even slip across the planes to drag people unwittingly into the dread domains. Those who live in these domains ascribe all sorts of sinister stories to the Mists—any supernatural happening, inexplicable disappearance, or malicious force can be blamed on the Mists.
hazards.sourceReference: Chapter 6: Cosmology - Shadowfell - Domains of Dread

portals.name: Shadow Crossings

requirement.description: Shadow crossings form in gloomy places where spirits or the stench of death lingers, such as battlefields, graveyards, and tombs. They manifest only in darkness, closing as soon as they feel light's kiss.
requirement.situationCondition: Must be in darkness; closes when exposed to light. Forms in gloomy places associated with death.

portals.colorOrAppearance: A blot of shadow in a dusty crypt, an open grave, or similar dark, death-associated location.

notableEntities.name: Dark Powers
notableEntities.title: Mysterious Entities of the Domains of Dread
notableEntities.description: Mysterious entities that collect the most wicked beings from across ages and worlds within inescapable, mist-shrouded demiplanes. They create Darklords and control the Mists.

notableEntities.name: Strahd von Zarovich
notableEntities.title: The First Vampire, Darklord of Barovia
notableEntities.description: The first vampire who rules over the valley of Barovia from the towering spires of Castle Ravenloft.

notableEntities.name: Ivana Boritsi
notableEntities.title: Darklord of Borca (The Poisoner)
notableEntities.description: A vicious poisoner who co-rules Borca amid opulent estates and impoverished villages, pursuing obsessive schemes.

notableEntities.name: Ivan Dilisnya
notableEntities.title: Darklord of Borca (The Stalker)
notableEntities.description: A childishly cruel stalker who co-rules Borca, pursuing obsessive schemes.

notableEntities.name: Vladeska Drakov
notableEntities.title: General, Darklord of Falkovnia
notableEntities.description: Commands a fierce military force that desperately clings to power against an endless plague of zombies.

notableEntities.name: Doctor Viktra Mordenheim
notableEntities.title: Darklord of Lamordia
notableEntities.description: An inventor and scholar whose efforts to create life and abolish death have led to tragedy, violating both natural and moral laws.

notableEntities.name: Chakuna
notableEntities.title: Darklord of Valachan
notableEntities.description: A devious hunter who roams the jungles of her domain, hunting the most dangerous beasts and drawing people into fatal contests.

specialRules.name: Domains of Dread: Mist-Shrouded Prison Demiplanes
specialRules.description: In a far-flung corner of the Shadowfell drifts a hidden expanse of roiling mist and vague semireality. Mysterious entities known as the Dark Powers collect the most wicked beings from across ages and worlds within inescapable, mist-shrouded demiplanes. The villainous beings become Darklords, able to exercise great power but confined to realms that twist their desires, capturing them in cycles of dread and despair.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: Darklords can exercise great power within their domains but are confined and cannot escape. Mists surround each domain, making it difficult to leave one domain and even harder to find a path to another. The Mists rise and fall at the whim of the Dark Powers and can slip across planes to drag people unwittingly into the dread domains.

specialRules.name: Shadowfell Despair Recovery
specialRules.description: After finishing a Long Rest, a character suffering from Shadowfell Despair can attempt to overcome it with a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. The DC is higher because it's harder to shake off despair once it has taken hold. On a successful save, the despair effect ends. A Calm Emotions spell or magic that removes curses also cures the despair.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: Recovery from Shadowfell Despair requires a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw after a Long Rest (higher than the initial DC 10 to resist). Calm Emotions spell or curse-removal magic also works.

specialRules.name: Despair Effect Replacement
specialRules.description: If a character is already suffering a despair effect and fails the Shadowfell Despair saving throw, the new despair effect replaces the old one. Despair effects do not stack.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: New despair effects replace existing ones rather than stacking.

escapeMethods: At the whim of the Dark Powers who control the Mists
Finding a path through the Mists (extremely difficult)

ruler.title: Monstrous Darklords
ruler.description: Three royal heirs—transformed into monsters by their depravity and hatred—battle endlessly to claim the throne of their ancient dynasty.

hazards: Mists of the Domains of Dread

domainsOrRegions.name: Lamordia

ruler.name: Doctor Viktra Mordenheim
ruler.title: Darklord of Lamordia
ruler.description: An inventor and scholar whose efforts to create life and abolish death have led to tragedy, violating both natural and moral laws in the frozen bogs and glacial expanses of Lamordia.

domainsOrRegions.description: Inventors and scholars violate both natural and moral laws in the frozen bogs and glacial expanses of Lamordia. The worst of them is the domain's Darklord, Doctor Viktra Mordenheim, whose efforts to create life and abolish death have led to tragedy.
hazards: Mists of the Domains of Dread

domainsOrRegions.name: Mordent

ruler.name: Unknown
ruler.description: The Darklord of Mordent is not specified in this source. The domain is the realm of ghost stories and hauntings.

domainsOrRegions.description: Death in Mordent heralds the beginning of a haunted afterlife as a restless spirit, for this domain is the realm of ghost stories and hauntings. The dead here earn no rest, no finality, no peace—just a passage into a shadow world of wispy phantoms, mournful groaning, and clanking chains.
hazards: Mists of the Domains of Dread

domainsOrRegions.name: Valachan

ruler.name: Chakuna
ruler.title: Darklord of Valachan
ruler.description: A devious hunter who roams the jungles of her domain, hunting the most dangerous beasts she can find. When she grows dissatisfied with simpler prey, she draws people into a fatal contest.

domainsOrRegions.description: The devious hunter Chakuna roams the jungles of her domain, hunting the most dangerous beasts she can find. When she grows dissatisfied with simpler prey, she draws people into a fatal contest, ensuring that the land remains steeped in blood.
hazards: Mists of the Domains of Dread

adventureThemes: Descents into mist-shrouded Domains of Dread where escape seems impossible
Confronting the most wicked beings imprisoned by the Dark Powers

adventureSituations.situation: People who venture into the woods keep accidentally wandering into the Feywild or the Shadowfell. They might never return, return with no sense of how much time has passed, or return dramatically changed.

crossReferences.description: The Domains of Dread are described in more detail in Van Richten's Guide to Ravenloft.
The adventure Curse of Strahd is set in Barovia, a Domain of Dread ruled by Strahd von Zarovich.

planarTravelMethods.name: Shadow Crossings
planarTravelMethods.description: Shadow crossings are locations where the veil between the Material Plane and the Shadowfell is so thin that creatures can pass from one plane to the other. They form in gloomy places where spirits or the stench of death lingers, such as battlefields, graveyards, and tombs. They manifest only in darkness, closing as soon as they feel light's kiss.
requirements: Location must be gloomy and associated with death or spirits
risks: Becoming trapped in a Domain of Dread

planarTravelMethods.name: The Mists
planarTravelMethods.description: The Mists of the Domains of Dread can slip across the planes to drag people unwittingly into the dread domains. They rise and fall at the whim of the Dark Powers.
requirements: None — the Mists act at the whim of the Dark Powers
risks: Becoming trapped in a Domain of Dread
Unable to escape without the Dark Powers' permission

planarTravelMethods.name: Plane Shift to Demiplane
planarTravelMethods.description: A Plane Shift spell can carry travelers to a demiplane such as a Domain of Dread, but the proper frequency required for the tuning fork can be extremely hard to acquire. The Gate spell is more reliable, assuming the caster knows of the demiplane.
requirements: Proper tuning fork frequency (extremely hard to acquire for demiplanes)
Knowledge of the demiplane for Gate spell
risks: Becoming trapped in a Domain of Dread
